channel.title: Making My Client Work for MAC Users
channel.description: How can i make my client available to users on macs? There telling me its not working for them so how can i get them to play?

item.title: Making My Client Work for MAC Users
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

My client runs perfectly on Macs without adding OS handling. Just double click the class file. Loaded.

Read full topic
item.source: Making My Client Work for MAC Users

item.title: Making My Client Work for MAC Users
item.dc:creator: @BabyMaker BabyMaker
item.description:
@BabyMaker wrote:

[quote=“cardguydude, post:5, topic:435283”][quote author=BabyMaker link=topic=538002.msg3934949#msg3934949 date=1330991436]

System.getProperty(“user.home”) instead of using C:/

I’m not entirely sure, but for Linux you use shells instead of MS-DOS (batch) files. So, you might have to make a shell. I’m sorry I can’t give you much more information than that.

This definitely doesn’t solve the problem but looks like it will help. Thanks.
[/quote]
It will help, you also must rename directories of sprites.[/quote]
DO you know exactly what must be done to make a client work for mac? If so maybe i could PM you to get more help?

Read full topic
item.source: Making My Client Work for MAC Users

item.title: Making My Client Work for MAC Users
item.dc:creator: @cardguydude cardguydude
item.description:
@cardguydude wrote:

[quote=“BabyMaker, post:4, topic:435283”][quote author=Skiire link=topic=538002.msg3934939#msg3934939 date=1330990873]
System.getProperty(“user.home”) instead of using C:/

I’m not entirely sure, but for Linux you use shells instead of MS-DOS (batch) files. So, you might have to make a shell. I’m sorry I can’t give you much more information than that.
[/quote]
This definitely doesn’t solve the problem but looks like it will help. Thanks.[/quote]
It will help, you also must rename directories of sprites.

Read full topic
